body: @longtimeago can you please help? Keep in mind [this](http://www.tpc2.com/dev/principles). If you have any technical questions, don't hesitate to ask right here
@longtimeago Task's budget is **30 mins** (see [this](http://www.tpc2.com/dev/principles) for explanation)
@yegor256 There is no `Github.relogin()` operation. It's blocker. Should it be there? I can't find such operation in API doc
yep, I see, but shouldn't it be in `Github`?
No, it's only for the mocking mechanism. We can't relogin with production Github, since we would need a new authentication information
@yegor256 please, review the test above. Is there something wrong?
In this example, the issue is created by `second` user, and we're reading it from the `first` user. Author login should still be `second`.
thank you for the hint! I'm about to start fixing

As far as I understand, the problem is not in `MkIssue`, but slightly dipper.
We store `Coordinates` in `Repo`, so ones it was created with login `first`

``` java
final Repo repo = first.repos().create(
        Json.createObjectBuilder().add("name", "test").build());
```

it stores this login and then we are tying to get and create issue with this login.

The problem is that we don't store the author of an issue. Our XML doesn't contain that information. When you retrieve an issue we inject author information on-fly, using `self`. But we should start storing author login together with the issue.

@yegor256 Please, close the issue
Thank you
@longtimeago Thanks a lot, I just topped your account for **30 mins**, transaction ID `DA2117804`
